required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Treatment With NeoRecormon (Epoetin Beta) in Patients With Chronic Renal Anemia
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-label Study of the Effect of NeoRecormon on Reduction of Cardiovascular Risk in Patients With Chronic Renal Anemia Who Are Not on Renal Replacement Therapy.

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate whether anemia prevention with NeoRecormon has an additional impact on reducing cardiovascular risk over conventional anemia treatment in patients mostly with stage IV chronic kidney disease and renal anemia. The anticipated time on study treatment is 2+ years and the target sample size is 500+ individuals.

primary_outcome.measure: Median Time to First Cardiovascular Event
primary_outcome.description: The cardiovascular event was defined as any of the following: angina pectoris leading to hospitalization for at least 24 hours or prolongation of hospitalization, acute heart failure, fatal or non-fatal myocardial infarction, fatal or non-fatal stroke, sudden death, transient cerebral ischemic attack (TIA), peripheral vascular disease (amputation, necrosis), cardiac arrhythmias leading to hospitalization for at least 24 hours or prolongation of hospitalization. The time to occurrence of a cardiovascular event was determined as the time from randomization until any of the above listed events whichever occurred first. The first event per participant was used for the analysis. Only events confirmed by the Endpoint Committee were considered for analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Time to Death Due to Cardiovascular Events
secondary_outcome.description: Time to death due to cardiovascular events is the time determined between randomization and death due to cardiovascular events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Died Due to Cardiovascular Events
secondary_outcome.description: The cardiovascular event was defined as any of the following: angina pectoris leading to hospitalization for at least 24 hours or prolongation of hospitalization, acute heart failure, fatal or non-fatal myocardial infarction, fatal or non-fatal stroke, sudden death, transient cerebral ischemic attack (TIA), peripheral vascular disease (amputation, necrosis), cardiac arrhythmias leading to hospitalization for at least 24 hours or prolongation of hospitalization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Time to Death Due to All Causes
secondary_outcome.description: Time to death due to all causes is the time determined between randomization and death due to all causes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Died Due to All Causes
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who died due to all causes are presented in table below.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing Worsening of New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class (CL) of Chronic Heart Failure From Baseline (BL)
secondary_outcome.description: The NYHA functional classification assesses the severity of symptoms of chronic heart failure and is comprised of four classes. Class I is defined as no limitation of physical activity, Class II is defined as slight limitation of physical activity, Class III is defined as marked limitation of physical activity, and Class IV is defined as unable to carry on any physical activity without discomfort. Shifts of participants from CL 0, CL I, CL II, CL III, CL IV at Baseline (Day 1) to CL 0, CL I, CL II, CL III, CL IV during the study period was determined and presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Time to First Cardiovascular Intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first cardiovascular intervention is the time between randomization and first intervention determined for all cardiovascular interventions after randomization. Cardiovascular interventions considered were: angioplasty with or without stents/atherectomy, coronary artery bypass surgery, cardioverter defibrillator (CD) cardioversion/defibrillation, temporary pacemaker, permanent pacemaker and implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) implantation.

Cardiovascular intervention was defined by a clinical review of all concomitant treatments. The cardiovascular interventions considered were: angioplasty with or without stents/atherectomy, coronary artery bypass surgery, cardioverter defibrillator (CD) cardioversion/defibrillation, temporary pacemaker, permanent pacemaker and implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) implantation. The total number of cardiovascular intervention was determined and presented by each cohort.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Time to First Hospitalization Due to Cardiovascular Events
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first hospitalization due to cardiovascular events is defined as the time determined between randomization and first hospitalization due to cardiovascular events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Hospitalization for Cardiovascular Events
secondary_outcome.description: The duration of hospitalization was the total number of days that a participant was hospitalized due to cardiovascular events. Participants with no hospitalization were excluded from analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Left Ventricular Mass Index (LVMI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, and Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: LVMI is determined by echocardiogram. LVMI indexed to body surface area (gram/square meter) estimated by LV cavity dimension and wall thickness at end-diastole. The change was calculated as week value minus baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) and Fractional Myocardial Shortening (FS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, and Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: LVEF is a marker of left ventricular systolic function and determined by echocardiogram. It is expressed as the ratio of left ventricular stroke volume (LVSV) to left ventricular end-diastolic volume (LVEDV), and is measured as a percentage. FS is used as an estimate of myocardial contractility and determined by echocardiogram and measures as a percentage. The change for LVEF and FS was calculated as Week value minus baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Left Ventricular Volume (LV Volume )
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, and Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: Left Ventricular Volume is the estimated of left ventricular end-diastolic volume (LVEDv) and left ventricular end-systolic volume (LVESV) determined by Echocardiogram. The change was calculated as week value minus baseline value.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Year 1, Year 2, Year 3, and Year 4
secondary_outcome.description: Mean values of Echocardiography (ECHO) Parameters: Left Ventricular End Diastolic Diameter (LVEDD), Left Ventricular Posterior Wall Thickness (LVPWT), IV Septal Wall Thickness (IVSWT), LV End Systolic Diameter (LVESD), LV Relative wall thickness (LVRWT) at Baseline, Year 1, Year 2, Year 3 and Year 4 were presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Values of Body Surface Area
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Year 1, Year 2, Year 3, and Year 4.
secondary_outcome.description: The body surface area (BSA) was determined by Echocardiogram. Absolute mean values of Echocardiography (ECHO) Parameter: Body surface area (BSA) at Baseline, Year 1, Year 2, Year 3 and Year 4 were calculated and presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in the Scores of Each of The Eight Health Scales of Quality of Life Based on Short Form-36 (SF-36) Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: The Quality of life was assessed on the basis of a change from baseline in the scores of each of the eight health scales in the SF-36 questionnaire. The SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 domains (consisting of 2 components; physical and mental) of functional health and well-being: physical and social functioning, physical and emotional role (role-physical, role-emotional) limitations, bodily pain, general health (GH), vitality, mental health. The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled from 0 (worst level of functioning) to 100 (100=best level of functioning). The least squares mean (LSM) change from baseline was determined by Analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model and presented for each of the eight health scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants on Blood Pressure/Anti-Hypertensive Treatment According to Class Of Drugs
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-hypertensive is defined as class of drugs that are used to treat hypertension. Numbers (No.) of participants treated with at least one hypertensive medication/Treatment (Tt) according to class of drugs were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Marked Laboratory Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 months up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Marked abnormality of laboratory parameters is defined as the value which is outside the defined reference range of that respective parameter. Values above and below the given reference range were determined as High or Low range values of the laboratory parameter. Roche's standard reference ranges for laboratory test parameters were used for the analysis. The laboratory parameters with marked abnormality are platelets (reference range is 150-350 10^9 cells/liter [L]), creatinine (reference range is 0-133 micromole per liter), albumin (reference range is 35.0-55 g/L), phosphate (reference range is 0.84-1.45 millimole per liter [mmol /L]) and potassium (reference range is 3.4-4.8 mmol /L).

arm_group.description: Participants received immediate epoetin beta therapy starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years to reach a target Hb level of 13-15 g/dL; with an individual Hb increase of at least 2 g/dL within approximately 3 months.

Participants received epoetin beta treatment starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years only when a decline in Hb levels to <10.5 g/dL had occurred in order to reach a target Hb of 10.5-11.5 g/dL.

intervention.description: Participants in the early treatment group immediately started epoetin beta treatment to reach a target Hb level of 13-15 g/dL at the end of the correction phase.
Participants in the late treatment Group started epoetin beta treatment once a decline in Hb level to <10.5 g/dL had occurred.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was conducted from 26 July 2000 to 13 December 2004 at 94 centers in 21 countries.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 605 participants, 603 started the study; 2 were withdrawn from the study due to non-compliance with good clinical practice and were excluded from the analysis.

group.title: Early Epoetin Beta Therapy
group.description: Participants received immediate epoetin beta therapy starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years to reach a target Hemoglobin (Hb) level of 13-15 gram/decilitre (g/dL) with an individual Hb increase of at least 2 g/dL within approximately 3 months.

group.title: Late Epoetin Beta Therapy
group.description: Participants received epoetin beta treatment starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years only when a decline in Hb levels to <10.5 g/dL has occurred in order to reach a target Hb of 10.5-11.5 g/dL.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Violation of Selection Criteria at Entry

baseline.population: Baseline characteristics were described for the intent-to-treat (ITT) population, which included all participants randomized according to their randomized treatment group, regardless of the treatment actually received.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measurement_list.measurement: Data was not available due to insufficient number of participants with cardiovascular events.
Data was not available due to insufficient number of participants with cardiovascular events.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis stated that there was no difference with regard to the event-free distribution of the combined endpoint of all protocol specified cardiovascular events between Early Epoetin beta therapy and Late Epoetin beta therapy groups.
analysis.estimate_desc: The Cox regression model was used to estimate the relative risk of the time to first cardiovascular event in Late Epoetin beta therapy group compared to the Early Epoetin beta therapy group.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Experiencing Worsening of New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class (CL) of Chronic Heart Failure From Baseline (BL)
outcome.description: The NYHA functional classification assesses the severity of symptoms of chronic heart failure and is comprised of four classes. Class I is defined as no limitation of physical activity, Class II is defined as slight limitation of physical activity, Class III is defined as marked limitation of physical activity, and Class IV is defined as unable to carry on any physical activity without discomfort. Shifts of participants from CL 0, CL I, CL II, CL III, CL IV at Baseline (Day 1) to CL 0, CL I, CL II, CL III, CL IV during the study period was determined and presented.
outcome.population: The ITT population included all participants randomized according to their randomized treatment group, regardless of the treatment actually received. The “n” represents the number of participants assessed for shifts in NYHA class from baseline.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) and Fractional Myocardial Shortening (FS)
outcome.description: LVEF is a marker of left ventricular systolic function and determined by echocardiogram. It is expressed as the ratio of left ventricular stroke volume (LVSV) to left ventricular end-diastolic volume (LVEDV), and is measured as a percentage. FS is used as an estimate of myocardial contractility and determined by echocardiogram and measures as a percentage. The change for LVEF and FS was calculated as Week value minus baseline value.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, and Week 48
outcome.population: The ITT population included all participants randomized according to their randomized treatment group, regardless of the treatment actually received. The “n” represents the number of participants assessed for LVEF and FS at Baseline, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, and Week 48.

group.title: Early Epoetin Beta Therapy
group.description: Participants received immediate epoetin beta therapy starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years to reach a target Hb level of 13-15 g/dL; with an individual Hb increase of at least 2 g/dL within approximately 3 months.

group.title: Late Epoetin Beta Therapy
group.description: Participants received epoetin beta treatment starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years only when a decline in Hb levels to <10.5 g/dL had occurred in order to reach a target Hb of 10.5-11.5 g/dL.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) and Fractional Myocardial Shortening (FS)
measure.description: LVEF is a marker of left ventricular systolic function and determined by echocardiogram. It is expressed as the ratio of left ventricular stroke volume (LVSV) to left ventricular end-diastolic volume (LVEDV), and is measured as a percentage. FS is used as an estimate of myocardial contractility and determined by echocardiogram and measures as a percentage. The change for LVEF and FS was calculated as Week value minus baseline value.
measure.population: The ITT population included all participants randomized according to their randomized treatment group, regardless of the treatment actually received. The “n” represents the number of participants assessed for LVEF and FS at Baseline, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, and Week 48.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Left Ventricular Volume (LV Volume )
outcome.description: Left Ventricular Volume is the estimated of left ventricular end-diastolic volume (LVEDv) and left ventricular end-systolic volume (LVESV) determined by Echocardiogram. The change was calculated as week value minus baseline value.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36, and Week 48
outcome.population: The ITT population included all participants randomized according to their randomized treatment group, regardless of the treatment actually received. The “n” represents the number of participants assessed for LV Volume at Baseline, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36 and Week 48.

group.title: Early Epoetin Beta Therapy
group.description: Participants received immediate epoetin beta therapy starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years to reach a target Hb level of 13-15 g/dL; with an individual Hb increase of at least 2 g/dL within approximately 3 months.

group.title: Late Epoetin Beta Therapy
group.description: Participants received epoetin beta treatment starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years only when a decline in Hb levels to <10.5 g/dL had occurred in order to reach a target Hb of 10.5-11.5 g/dL.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Left Ventricular Volume (LV Volume )
measure.description: Left Ventricular Volume is the estimated of left ventricular end-diastolic volume (LVEDv) and left ventricular end-systolic volume (LVESV) determined by Echocardiogram. The change was calculated as week value minus baseline value.
measure.population: The ITT population included all participants randomized according to their randomized treatment group, regardless of the treatment actually received. The “n” represents the number of participants assessed for LV Volume at Baseline, Week 12, Week 24, Week 36 and Week 48.

outcome.title: Mean Values of Echocardiography Parameters
outcome.description: Mean values of Echocardiography (ECHO) Parameters: Left Ventricular End Diastolic Diameter (LVEDD), Left Ventricular Posterior Wall Thickness (LVPWT), IV Septal Wall Thickness (IVSWT), LV End Systolic Diameter (LVESD), LV Relative wall thickness (LVRWT) at Baseline, Year 1, Year 2, Year 3 and Year 4 were presented.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Year 1, Year 2, Year 3, and Year 4
outcome.population: The ITT population included all participants randomized according to their randomized treatment group, regardless of the treatment actually received. The “n” represents the number of participants assessed for each echocardiography parameter at Baseline, Year 1, Year 2, Year 3 and Year 4.

group.title: Early Epoetin Beta Therapy
group.description: Participants received immediate epoetin beta therapy starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years to reach a target Hb level of 13-15 g/dL; with an individual Hb increase of at least 2 g/dL within approximately 3 months.

group.title: Late Epoetin Beta Therapy
group.description: Participants received epoetin beta treatment starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years only when a decline in Hb levels to <10.5 g/dL had occurred in order to reach a target Hb of 10.5-11.5 g/dL.

measure.title: Mean Values of Echocardiography Parameters
measure.description: Mean values of Echocardiography (ECHO) Parameters: Left Ventricular End Diastolic Diameter (LVEDD), Left Ventricular Posterior Wall Thickness (LVPWT), IV Septal Wall Thickness (IVSWT), LV End Systolic Diameter (LVESD), LV Relative wall thickness (LVRWT) at Baseline, Year 1, Year 2, Year 3 and Year 4 were presented.
measure.population: The ITT population included all participants randomized according to their randomized treatment group, regardless of the treatment actually received. The “n” represents the number of participants assessed for each echocardiography parameter at Baseline, Year 1, Year 2, Year 3 and Year 4.

outcome.title: Mean Values of Body Surface Area
outcome.description: The body surface area (BSA) was determined by Echocardiogram. Absolute mean values of Echocardiography (ECHO) Parameter: Body surface area (BSA) at Baseline, Year 1, Year 2, Year 3 and Year 4 were calculated and presented.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Year 1, Year 2, Year 3, and Year 4.
outcome.population: The ITT population included all participants randomized according to their randomized treatment group, regardless of the treatment actually received. The “n” represents the number of participants assessed for Body surface area through echocardiogram at Baseline, Year 1, Year 2, Year 3 and Year 4.

group.title: Early Epoetin Beta Therapy
group.description: Participants received immediate epoetin beta therapy starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years to reach a target Hb level of 13-15 g/dL; with an individual Hb increase of at least 2 g/dL within approximately 3 months.

group.title: Late Epoetin Beta Therapy
group.description: Participants received epoetin beta treatment starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years only when a decline in Hb levels to <10.5 g/dL had occurred in order to reach a target Hb of 10.5-11.5 g/dL.

measure.title: Mean Values of Body Surface Area
measure.description: The body surface area (BSA) was determined by Echocardiogram. Absolute mean values of Echocardiography (ECHO) Parameter: Body surface area (BSA) at Baseline, Year 1, Year 2, Year 3 and Year 4 were calculated and presented.
measure.population: The ITT population included all participants randomized according to their randomized treatment group, regardless of the treatment actually received. The “n” represents the number of participants assessed for Body surface area through echocardiogram at Baseline, Year 1, Year 2, Year 3 and Year 4.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in the Scores of Each of The Eight Health Scales of Quality of Life Based on Short Form-36 (SF-36) Questionnaire
outcome.description: The Quality of life was assessed on the basis of a change from baseline in the scores of each of the eight health scales in the SF-36 questionnaire. The SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 domains (consisting of 2 components; physical and mental) of functional health and well-being: physical and social functioning, physical and emotional role (role-physical, role-emotional) limitations, bodily pain, general health (GH), vitality, mental health. The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled from 0 (worst level of functioning) to 100 (100=best level of functioning). The least squares mean (LSM) change from baseline was determined by Analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model and presented for each of the eight health scale.
outcome.population: The ITT population included all participants randomized according to their randomized treatment group, regardless of the treatment actually received.

group.title: Early Epoetin Beta Therapy
group.description: Participants received immediate epoetin beta therapy starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years to reach a target Hb level of 13-15 g/dL; with an individual Hb increase of at least 2 g/dL within approximately 3 months.

group.title: Late Epoetin Beta Therapy
group.description: Participants received epoetin beta treatment starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years only when a decline in Hb levels to <10.5 g/dL had occurred in order to reach a target Hb of 10.5-11.5 g/dL.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in the Scores of Each of The Eight Health Scales of Quality of Life Based on Short Form-36 (SF-36) Questionnaire
measure.description: The Quality of life was assessed on the basis of a change from baseline in the scores of each of the eight health scales in the SF-36 questionnaire. The SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 domains (consisting of 2 components; physical and mental) of functional health and well-being: physical and social functioning, physical and emotional role (role-physical, role-emotional) limitations, bodily pain, general health (GH), vitality, mental health. The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled from 0 (worst level of functioning) to 100 (100=best level of functioning). The least squares mean (LSM) change from baseline was determined by Analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model and presented for each of the eight health scale.
measure.population: The ITT population included all participants randomized according to their randomized treatment group, regardless of the treatment actually received.

outcome.title: Number of Participants on Blood Pressure/Anti-Hypertensive Treatment According to Class Of Drugs
outcome.description: Anti-hypertensive is defined as class of drugs that are used to treat hypertension. Numbers (No.) of participants treated with at least one hypertensive medication/Treatment (Tt) according to class of drugs were reported.
outcome.population: The safety analysis population included all participants who were randomized and who had received a safety follow-up whether or not they had received epoetin beta treatment.

group.title: Early Epoetin Beta Therapy
group.description: Participants received immediate epoetin beta therapy starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years to reach a target Hb level of 13-15 g/dL; with an individual Hb increase of at least 2 g/dL within approximately 3 months.

group.title: Late Epoetin Beta Therapy
group.description: Participants received epoetin beta treatment starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years only when a decline in Hb levels to <10.5 g/dL had occurred in order to reach a target Hb of 10.5-11.5 g/dL.

measure.title: Number of Participants on Blood Pressure/Anti-Hypertensive Treatment According to Class Of Drugs
measure.description: Anti-hypertensive is defined as class of drugs that are used to treat hypertension. Numbers (No.) of participants treated with at least one hypertensive medication/Treatment (Tt) according to class of drugs were reported.
measure.population: The safety analysis population included all participants who were randomized and who had received a safety follow-up whether or not they had received epoetin beta treatment.

class.title: No. of participants with at least one Tt

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Marked Laboratory Abnormalities
outcome.description: Marked abnormality of laboratory parameters is defined as the value which is outside the defined reference range of that respective parameter. Values above and below the given reference range were determined as High or Low range values of the laboratory parameter. Roche’s standard reference ranges for laboratory test parameters were used for the analysis. The laboratory parameters with marked abnormality are platelets (reference range is 150-350 10^9 cells/liter [L]), creatinine (reference range is 0-133 micromole per liter), albumin (reference range is 35.0-55 g/L), phosphate (reference range is 0.84-1.45 millimole per liter [mmol /L]) and potassium (reference range is 3.4-4.8 mmol /L).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 months up to 4 years
outcome.population: The safety analysis population included all participants who were randomized and who had received a safety follow-up whether or not they had received epoetin beta treatment. The ‘’n” represents the number of participants assessed for each laboratory parameter.

group.title: Early Epoetin Beta Therapy
group.description: Participants received immediate epoetin beta therapy starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years to reach a target Hb level of 13-15 g/dL; with an individual Hb increase of at least 2 g/dL within approximately 3 months.

group.title: Late Epoetin Beta Therapy
group.description: Participants received epoetin beta treatment starting at 2000 IU, subcutaneously once weekly up to four years only when a decline in Hb levels to <10.5 g/dL had occurred in order to reach a target Hb of 10.5-11.5 g/dL.

measure.description: Marked abnormality of laboratory parameters is defined as the value which is outside the defined reference range of that respective parameter. Values above and below the given reference range were determined as High or Low range values of the laboratory parameter. Roche’s standard reference ranges for laboratory test parameters were used for the analysis. The laboratory parameters with marked abnormality are platelets (reference range is 150-350 10^9 cells/liter [L]), creatinine (reference range is 0-133 micromole per liter), albumin (reference range is 35.0-55 g/L), phosphate (reference range is 0.84-1.45 millimole per liter [mmol /L]) and potassium (reference range is 3.4-4.8 mmol /L).
measure.population: The safety analysis population included all participants who were randomized and who had received a safety follow-up whether or not they had received epoetin beta treatment. The ‘’n” represents the number of participants assessed for each laboratory parameter.

reported_events.desc: An adverse event is any untoward medical event that occurs in a participant administered an investigational product, and it does not necessarily indicate only events with clear causal relationship with the relevant investigational product.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
